website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive filter that is easy to use; but not the most powerful. Plus the extras you'll need to purchase will add to the price.
pros: Pump has protective double insulated walls
Little maintenance required, as filter cartridge can be easily rinsed and used repeatedly
cons: You'll have to purchase hoses and adapters separately

website_summaries.verdict: A great upgrade for smaller manufacturer-included pumps in aboveground pools, though fitting attachments can be a pain.
pros: Powerful enough to keep average-sized aboveground pools fresh and circulating
cons: May take some retrofitting to securely fit aboveground pools, as hoses and other attachments aren’t universal

customer_reviews.title: We used for our Summer Waves Pool no problem!! Better pump and CHEAPER than a replacement!!
customer_reviews.text: After our Summer Waves pump SFX1000 went out.. I quickly found a just a new motor was priced outrageous, almost the cost of the pool!! I researched and found people have been adapting this pump to their pools... it was not just exclusive to the Intex Brand. For almost half the cost.... and for a stronger pump... this is the way to go!! All hoses were the same size and we were able to hook it up with little effort. The weight of the output hose was heavier than the old one, so we used zip ties for extra support.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Adapters sold separately.
customer_reviews.text: While this pump was a vast improvement over the smaller one that came with my pool, it was a little annoying to discover that I needed to purchase hose adapters separately. It would go a long way towards customer service to just include them in the box rather than anger people by leaving them out. IF YOU ARE USING THE SMALLER PUMP AND HOSES, BUY THE ADAPTERS ALONG WITH THIS PUMP! Otherwise the pump works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Colby

customer_reviews.title: What a difference
customer_reviews.text: The flow of this one, compared to the tiny pump/filter it came with is just awesome. I did have to buy the adapters and the shut off valves. I'd absolutely recommend getting this pump. If things change, I will edit my review. PS I didnt want the pool in the front yard, the wife insisted it go there.
customer_reviews.author: 95XJ

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is working awesome! Better than the one that came with the pool ever did! We used it with a Coleman (Bestway) 18'x48" round above ground pool. I didn't realize when I ordered, but it comes with 2 new hoses and a new inlet piece. Although we would not have needed to switch out the inlet piece we had, I'm glad we did because the new one has an aerating feature that circulates the water more effectively.
customer_reviews.author: leashells

customer_reviews.title: Priming the pump is key to getting this to work
customer_reviews.text: Works great once I primed the pump. Initially, it was making a gargerly sound. I had followed the instructions, so I was starting to get annoyed. Then I figured I could 'hot start' the pump but adding water into the cartridge section of the pump to help get it going. It took a couple minutes, but it started to pump in and filter out water. I'm using this pump filter for a stick tank pool 8 ft in diameter. The directions were silent on priming the pump which is unfortunate since I was starting to think this was a piece of garbage
customer_reviews.author: A mama zon

customer_reviews.title: Filter is worth the price
customer_reviews.text: The filter works amazingly well even though it is being used on a non Intex pool. With this Intex filter our summer waves pool has almost crystal clear water and hardly any little dead bugs or messy debris floating in the water. . The manufacturer filter was very poor compared to this one. The best feature is the built in timer, not having to worry about when to turn it on is a great help because the water gets circulated and cleaned daily. So far no problems with the filter at all. It was reasonably priced, the parts appear to be well made and the directions were average easy to understand for assembly. I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: linda white

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after 32 days
customer_reviews.text: Update: Intex has a 90 day curtesy replacement policy and sent me a new pump no questions asked. It was a surprisingly easy process. Worked great for a month and then just stopped working out of nowhere. In the middle of July during a heat wave. Just won’t turn on. Two days after the return window! Seriously?!! I had bought it to replace the dinky 330gph that came with our Intel 10x30. Thankfully I saved the 330gph pump. I’ve had to set that one back up but it’s so underpowered for this pool that I have to run it 12hrs minimum AND the cartridge has to be hosed off DAILY. Great.
customer_reviews.author: LauraBookish

customer_reviews.title: Great pump, but loud
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pump, but loud. Works great as a dedicated pump for the Intex skimmer. Have used for 2 seasons now, still good as new. Using it with 10'x30" easy set pool, so the adapters were required. Return line draped over pool edge, secured with duct tape.
customer_reviews.author: PaulT

customer_reviews.title: Low Cost Solution
customer_reviews.text: This pump and filter work great on my DYI hottub. There is enough dynamic head to push the water 4 ft up through 60ft of 1/2" copper pipe and still provide adequate flow. I treat my tub with bromine tablets and change the filter when needed; the tub has never been cloudy. It has been running 3 hrs a day everyday for almost 6 months exposed to the weather. I dont know how the winter will treat it though. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald B. Laycock

customer_reviews.title: Order isn’t as described
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a filter system and When I went to assemble it I had noticed there are a bunch of parts missing. Plunger valves (2) hose rings (4) step washer strainer nut (2) flat strainer rubber washer (2) threaded strainer connector (1) adjustable pool inlet jet nozzle (1) air jet valve (1) inlet threaded air connector (1) air jet valve cap (1) pump hose with nuts (2) I’m not quite sure how they handle their purchases or how they conduct services such as this huge over sight of parts, but I know for sure that one doesn’t order a filter unit and only receive less then 25% of the entire order.
customer_reviews.author: Maura K. Hnatew

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like a grinder
customer_reviews.text: Sounds like a grinder. Also now pumping air. I have been using for aprox. 1 month. Fittings I ordered to adapt larger hose to my pool are junk. First week worked great, really moves the water, keeping the pool clean. Second week came home to a fitting leak, lost about 500 gallons of water. Repaired new fitting with tape. few weeks later anther leak, lost another 500 to 800 gallons. Not sure the pump will last 3-4 seasons as others have said. Biggest issue is with the fittings constantly re-tightening and leaking water or sucking air. Would highly recommend coming up with your own heavier fittings. Will see how long pump last.
customer_reviews.author: Techguy

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service please show up!
customer_reviews.text: The pump was good and it did what it was supposed to do. I'm giving it 1 star because it stopped working one day, close to the 1 year of purchase and even though I tried to contact the manufacturer's customer service through Amazon I had not heard from them. I hope to hear from them before the warranty expires and they are able to help with the defective pump. I'll be more than happy to change the rating if they contact me, but they need to show up and do their part. Andrea.//
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: stock tank pool
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on a stock tank pool. you need additional parts to make it work. buy the extra parts from your pool supply store otherwise you end up spending way too much on prorietary intex parts. yes there are other solutions to adapters and parts that are way cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: It is a filter
customer_reviews.text: Our previous filter included with pool burnt out. My fault it was mounted on the side and when water level gets low, water should be added. I did not add water and the filter burnt out. I hated that filter. So my genius husband replaced it with this. He managed to adapt the fittings so we could utilize this pump. It does filter so that is a plus, and it is lower so that there is no possibility of running water too low. Trust me I forget to add water a lot but this has stood the test of time so far. Hopefully, it will continue to last.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Winkelman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and filters great but rather loud
customer_reviews.text: It really does push a lot of water compaired to the stock pump that came with our pool and filters nicely. There are two downfalls to it though the first being the noise....it is considerably louder than i would like and the second is the timer. I would prefer the timer be set in a way that you can have it run 1 or 2 hours at a time 3 or four times a day rather than just one block if time every day. Good quality hoses but the hose clamps suck...I recommend spending a fee dollars and going and getting yourself some quality clamps at at a home improvement center or auto parts store..
customer_reviews.author: Hailey Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Not a complete product, money Hungry
customer_reviews.text: So you buy a water pump/filter for the pool. You get it home and start to put it together, only to find out to finish installing it you have to make additional purchases. Anything for a buck, called the company to order the parts that SHOULD have come with it and their out of stock. So I have to wait another week to call back and hope they have them otherwise this product is useless as is. My advice is to find another company that isnt gonna nickel and dime you just to get the product working. Its rediculous that they sell 3/4 of a product and insist you buy the rest of it in a separate purchase. Never Again
customer_reviews.author: Krystal D Kaster

customer_reviews.title: Reliable filter pump
customer_reviews.text: Connected this pump to my Intex 10' x 30" above-ground pool, replacing the weak original pump. I purchased the 2-pack 1.25"-to-1.5" adapters for Intex hoses, model 25009 (this pump has 1.5" hoses). It's been running strong for a month now, 2 filter changes, no issues. The pump output drops considerably when the filter needs changing. Filtration seems adequate; could be better if I had 1.5" pool hose fittings, but no complaints. As I leave the GFI plug outside, the GFI trips when it gets rained on, but I can live with that (shows the protection circuit is working).
customer_reviews.author: Scoobi_FreeBSD

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: Worked great 1st year. Started making noise last year. Now it wont run at all. I didnt pay what its listed for now . I think i paid $150 . Now in 2020 it shows $300 or more. Absolutely NOT worth that much. I wasnt going to give a poor review because the price was low and thought okay . 2 years get what ya pay for i'll buy another pump. Because it does have strong suction. But it does not stand the test of time. Better off getting large pump and filter elsewhere. Pool itself is very good. Pump needs reengineering !
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Just buy the adaptor at the same time.
customer_reviews.text: I did have to buy adaptors to fit my pool. It would have been nice to know I needed the adaptors ahead of time so that I could have ordered them at the same time and had the filter running sooner. But is has worked well and is keeping the water clear. Update, the filter barely pumps out any water, it is extremely slow water flow, and it has not even been 2 months. I am disappointed. I will have to see if the 1 year warranty holds.
customer_reviews.author: Chiviz

customer_reviews.title: If you have small hoses you will to purchase adaptors separately
customer_reviews.text: I have an Intex 18x48 Easy Set pool. The pump that came with it seemed to work fine until I tried to use the Index vacuum. There just wasn't enough suction. I purchased the next size up which is this one. The hoses are different sizes. The instructions do not mention the possibility of this problem. I spent two weeks searching the internet for ways to solve this issue. I was ready to return the pump when I tried "Index adaptor" in my search engine. Up came the hose connectors i needed. Woohoo. I hooked them up and was in business in no time. The vacuum worked great and the difference in the pump circulation is huge.
customer_reviews.author: Clutter Phobe

customer_reviews.title: Great and Powerful Little Pump
customer_reviews.text: Great filter pump! I upgraded to this one and tossed the pump I received with my 10'x30"h Intex Pool. The other pump was a struggling to clean the water and I had an orange tinge from all the iron the other pump couldn't remove fast enough. I turned this pump on and my pool was clear and clean literally the next day. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal Lynn Noll

customer_reviews.title: Great pump
customer_reviews.text: We upgraded our Intex pump that came with a 10x 18 pool. This pump was perfect. It is powerful and moved tons more water than the pump that came with the pool. It has literally been running 24/7 for 3 months with no problems. We did need the adapters that other reviewers recommended. My only issue with the pool was that the pool has two hoses for intake and the pump only has one. We just used the farthest hose and looped the other one back to itself to seal that hole. This has worked perfectly wi5h no leakages. I hose the filter weekly and have only replaced it once. I highly recommend this pump.
customer_reviews.author: CCravens

customer_reviews.title: Good pump but gotta watch what model comes in
customer_reviews.text: When it was shipped it was a different pump what I mean by that is same model put different face covering. It had just a turning switch for the power not a button. It broke before 30 days and asked for the company I bought it off of for a replacement. That one came in and it's the one pictured that I ordered. If your break it's so hard to get a hold of intex for replacement or parts. And sometimes you have to email the company you got it off of to get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Mommyof2

customer_reviews.title: Beware!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Nice pump if we could actually use it! Sadly, many of the parts that are needed ARE NOT included in this kit! Not only that, but when you go to their website to purchase the parts, many are no longer available, which is frustrating!!! Now we have a pool that needs a pump and some sad grandchildren!!!
customer_reviews.author: E.C.

customer_reviews.title: No Connecting Parts
customer_reviews.text: Order this filter/ pump to replace a RX1000 that came with my Summer Wave 18’ x 42”. Pump is a bit loud than the 1000, but works great at pushing the water they the filtering system. My main bitch, it that this pump only came with an outlet nozzle and no other connecting hardware. Per the manufacturer, if you buy only the pump, that’s all you get. Instead of buy $40 more of parts and time it take to get or find them, I found this guy’s quick fix. Go to the hardware store (I went to Home Depot) and buy 2 -1 1/2” rubber couplings $10, works great
customer_reviews.author: Rudolph X Contreras

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to spend more money on their website!
customer_reviews.text: What is not mentioned is that you DON'T get all the parts you need! You have to go to their website and buy the intake hose, washers, connector and other things to make it work right!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the timer on it
customer_reviews.text: It is noisy, as everyone says, but it doesn't have to be run while swimming! I like the timer on it. Once it quit for several days, and then randomly began working again. I'm not sure what the problem was. The company said it was out of warranty (after 6 weeks) and the insurance company said it was still under warranty and I should contact the company. So happy it began running again, because I was not happy with THAT solution!
customer_reviews.author: Mincks 2

customer_reviews.title: what a piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.text: What a crock of ****! This thing ran for 10 secs and the fan jammed. Started smoking and making a god awful humming noise. Fire hazard. Poorly made. Plastic fan basically spun off its motor rod. So upset. Cant even clean the pool during quarantine. Sad Intex. Very pathetic.
customer_reviews.author: prometheus82

customer_reviews.title: Buy the adapter!!
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit loud but it moves a lot more water than the unit that came with the pool. The first thing I noticed is how much more efficiently the skimmer worked. UPDATE: I reduced my rating to 2 stars because the water flow is not consistent and/or it doesn't take much for the unit to clog up enough to reduce the flow significantly. I cleaned the filter and 12 hours later I was noticing a reduction in flow again. Inspection of the filter showed very little dirt/debris, not something that should reduce flow to that level. Buy the adapter as suggested in other posts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need advice
customer_reviews.text: Is this normal for the ring to be half and not all the way around - I can’t get the hose to thread onto it
customer_reviews.author: Person in Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Very effective upgrade for Intex 12’ pool.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a smaller pump that comes with the Intex 12’ x 32” pool. This one works very well. I haven’t had to use ‘shock treatment’ since I installed this pump, just a 3” chlorine tablet about twice a month. Also, makes the vacuum much more effective. My only complaint is that it only lasted a year, whereas the smaller pump lasted 3 years. Still, it works so well that I bought another for this year.
customer_reviews.author: Luce

customer_reviews.title: No customer service response
customer_reviews.text: I realize Covid has caused problems. But I started reaching out in early March about this pump. Last summer it worked fine and then I put it away for the winter in a heated garage. When I tried to use it again, it rattled like a bearing is out. I have called, written, sent UPS overnight letters and no response at all. They are more than happy to take an order online, but no response at all. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Freytag

customer_reviews.title: careful on the fitting sizes. 💩 out in 3 days
customer_reviews.text: seems to be a good pump but be careful. the size of the fittings is not clear in the description. you may need an adapter if you are upgrading your pump from the smaller one to go from the 2" screw on fitting to the smaller clamp on fittings 1.5" or 1.25" hose fittings Update: just put up pool for the year and got the pump going good ... The first day. 3rd day it was ever used this year it 💩 out on my no water flow pressure. Might be 1 gallon per hour now. Purchased end of season last year so ...
customer_reviews.author: rzuace

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect, as it should
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for pump (which lasted 5 yrs) received when we got the pool. But the pump I received is different from the picture. Original pump and the one pictured show a toggle switch for on/off/timer and a dial to set the number of hours for the timer. The new pump has just the dial for all. Doesn't matter either way as both work fine. I just preferred the toggle switch because it was easier to use for where I have it located.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Pump sounds rough, but is working
customer_reviews.text: While this pump does work the one I have right out of the box sounds rough. The sound it makes as it works sounds like it is a small mixing machine. I would have thought it would have sounded like just water being pumped into and out of the unit, but I was really thinking it might be a bad unit and is kind of grinding it self to pieces (or sounds that way). It does work and turns the water real well for our pool but will it last?
customer_reviews.author: C.W. Dykes

customer_reviews.title: Kind of loud but has more filter power.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is LOUD....but it pumps out quite a bit of water. I like the auto timer options, that's a huge help. The one thing is that the hoses are 1.5 instead of the smaller 1.25 so of course now my strainer and inlet won't fit so i either have to buy larger ones or find a conversion kit for the hoses. Other than that so far the pump is great....This is a replacement for the 637 that stopped working after 2 months (brand new) I called Intex and they were sending a new one but who knows when that will arrive so i bought this larger heavy duty one.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Needed adapters- sold separate- Good other than that.
customer_reviews.text: The pool I have is a circular softside, about 8 feet in diameter and approx 1000 gallons. The pump itself works fine and does a good job of cleaning the pool. However, I needed to purchase adapters for the hoses that came with the pump. I took the advice of others in their review and purchased the adapters at the same time I bought the pump to prevent any further delay. I am glad I did because it would not have worked with out it.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Cooper

customer_reviews.title: FALSE ADVERTISING
customer_reviews.text: The title of this pool filter says it does 1,500 GPH (gallons per hour) which was the whole purpose of me getting it because my pool skimmer had to have a filter that was at LEAST 1,500. I hook up my skimmer and it still doesn’t work and that’s because this filter does less than 1,200! Yes even 300 gallons makes a difference! Remember it had to be MINIMUM 1,500. So yes I’m pissed.
customer_reviews.author: Ebony Swain

customer_reviews.title: Only works with bigger pools
customer_reviews.text: This does not work with 12x30 pools it was missing parts I had to rig it to work. There was no air adaptor like it said it should. I am disappointed I got Intel because I thought it was the best not sure anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Archuleta

customer_reviews.title: For small above ground pools...it's perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I buy this filter instead of the one that comes with the small above ground pool and I have a clear pool all summer long. You just have to add a tablet of chlorine in the pool every once in a while. My neighbors always ask me how my pool stays so clear and clean and I tell them it is because I purchase a bigger filter than what my pool comes with. Super simple idea.
customer_reviews.author: S. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Necessary upgrade, but loud and incomplete kit
customer_reviews.text: The upgrade you get by installing this pump is totally worth it even for the 10’ round model. Three small complaints — the timer function should be an ‘intermittent’ type where you could set it to run on/off cycles every few hours instead of a straight timer -AND- the pump doesn't come with all of the adaptors you may need. -AND- its loud
customer_reviews.author: Mustava Dalilai

customer_reviews.title: Great pump
customer_reviews.text: We have a pretty big above ground rectangular pool. We originally had a huge pump that came with it (not sure of the size) and our pool would turn green constantly... even with chemicals and chlorine. Bought this smaller pump (hoping it would work for our size pool) and it's amazing. Still use chemicals and chlorine, of course, but not as much as we had to with the old pump. And we have to run this 1 less than the old 1. This tiny pump works great and I highly recommend... especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna

customer_reviews.title: Died after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: It's junk. Ordered in June 2019, died completely in early September 2019. We took really good care of it, kept it clean, changed out the filters when we were supposed to, kept it in the shade, etc. We didn't run it for longer than 4 hours per week in our 700 gallon stock tank pool. The impeller is not blocked and I can't see what else could be wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri D

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my application
customer_reviews.text: This seems to work well so far. I've only had it running for a week, but it hasn't missed a beat yet. Doesn't quite flow as much water as I thought it would, but it definitely cleans my pool. 15'X3.5' round pool with inflatable ring at the top. I was able to adapt the old hoses to fit with the hoses from this pump which I'm sure limits the flow a little. I like the timer so it isn't running all the time, but runs long enough to clean the pool. water looks clear every day so far.
customer_reviews.author: jymmiphreak

customer_reviews.title: NOT a complete system for your stock tank pool.
customer_reviews.text: Does not come with valves so you can stop the flow of water and replace the filter Seems useless not to have them. Most importantly it does not come with the outlet, only inlet water. It is clear that they don’t want you to be able to use this with any system besides theirs. I’m stuck with eBay or similar to find parts as they won’t sell them either. $100 pump turning out to be a $200 pump. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Mooooommm!

customer_reviews.title: ... other one I had ordered that was not a good one at all and when it came there was ...
customer_reviews.text: I waited on this filter to arrive to replace the other one I had ordered that was not a good one at all and when it came there was two other parts to install the filter that was not with this filter. I had to go back and order the valves that went with this pool before it can be installed. This should be in bold letters that this needs these valves along with this filter or at least include everything when you order it. I was really disappointed. Now I have to wait another week before this part arrives!!! NOT GOOD BUSINESS!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Half the Cost, Good Pump
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace a slimmer pump for a 16’ round Summer Waves pool. It works great though it’s more of a hassle to replace the filter. This pump was also over half the cost of the replacement slimmer pump... The hoses were the correct sizes (1.5”) but have a different end pieces to them. I was able to use metal hose clamps (1.5”) to hold them in place. Problem solved for a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Jacey Morrill

customer_reviews.title: Works great! No problems, super easy install
customer_reviews.text: Got this for 8ft. Quick Set pool by polygroup. Had to also buy the connectors because the house is bigger than the outlet coming from the pool, but they were cheap. Only took a few minutes to install it all on the pool, super easy. The pump is a little loud, but not overwhelming. The timer function is awesome. Pump should probably work with much bigger pools, too.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac A Diaz

customer_reviews.title: missing important parts UNHAPPY
customer_reviews.text: this was supposed to be and entire replacement unit only to it find out once getting it i need to buy over 40$ in additional parts. compleatly unacceptable. I demand the missing hoses and outlet parts as show tithe the two extra hose's and t-connector that was also missing. I cant believe how dissappointed i am with a product i was so happy to order!!!
customer_reviews.author: Akleibs666

customer_reviews.title: Good pump
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pump. But it keeps loosing suction power for some reason. It’s not clogged and all hoses and filter are clean. I have to unscrew the top and keep letting all the air out. Not sure why it keeps getting air as everything is tight and we can’t find and leaks. Other than that it works great. It’s allot better than the ones that come with the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, great filtering power
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. I have a Coleman vinyl 4 ft by 18 ft pool and all I had to do was connect the pump to my existing hoses.
customer_reviews.author: Click

customer_reviews.title: It worked as designed
customer_reviews.text: We had bought another one that was bigger to replace the one that messed up. That bigger one messed up too quick. We then bought this one that was almost identical to the original one. Functionally, we did not have any issue with it and it worked and functioned perfectly. Will hopefully provide another review or update on this after year 2..
customer_reviews.author: Duane Lster

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase for Filter Pump Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: We bought the Intex 10'x33" pool and the filter pump that comes with it is a joke. After reading numerous reviews about people upgrading to this pump I caved. Worth every penny! You do need hose conversion kit (, but it is only $12. Setup in minutes and pool was clear within a couple of hours.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Walsh

customer_reviews.title: STOPPED WORKING AROUND 30 DAYS, SELLER ONLY ACCEPTS RETURNS FOR "NEW" PUMPS
customer_reviews.text: STOPPED WORKING AROUND 30 DAYS, SELLER ONLY ACCEPTS RETURNS FOR "NEW" PUMPS. So had to deal with INTEX. INTEX doesn't answer their phone (1-800-234-6839), you can email in a request for assistance. BUT its been 4 weeks and no reply. VERY DISAPPOINTED!
customer_reviews.author: L. Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: Great easy set upgrade
customer_reviews.text: From what I’ve read this is a great replacement for the pump that comes with most small above ground pools. I like the timer function. Have it set to run over night. To replace the smaller pump you will need to enlarge the holes for the filter and return line. You will also need 2 plunger valves and strainer. Only comes with the jet nozzle.
customer_reviews.author: Tilo Larios Jr

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful enough to pick up most bits of sand but works well otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for our small stock tank pool. Haven't figured out how to install hoses into pool side yet, so we just stuck them down into pool and weighed down with a brick. Covered up inlet with a net bag to prevent large items from going in.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Kershaw

customer_reviews.title: Great powerful, inexpensive pump
customer_reviews.text: The impeller on the OEM pump wore out and the replacement Summer Waves part was twice as much as this whole pump. I had to buy and adapter and do a little engineering, but it was well worth it. The only minor issue is the pump sits on the ground , so when replacing the filter the full head pressure of the pool is pushing on the cover.
customer_reviews.author: Samofnewton

customer_reviews.title: Not Powerful Enough
customer_reviews.text: We have a 15 foot pool and used this pump with little to no results. At first it sucks strong, but within 2 hours of running water through the filters they're clogged and require cleaning/replacing. We've gone through so many filters (and they're not cheap) trying to get our pool clear. We're upgrading to a sand pump. I'd advise against these types of pumps.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rumble

customer_reviews.title: Product unusable, did not match description.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this pump to replace the one we have for our pool. The product descriptions claims this pump has 1.5 inch hoses and hose fitting. That is exactly what our pool uses. However, the hoses and hose fittings are 2 inches. Because of that, we cannot use this with our Intex pool or attach it in any way. To make matters worse, we've been waiting for warm weather that and for the recent rain to stop to set it up. We just opened it and realized it is the wrong product and now we are past the return window by 5 days.
customer_reviews.author: Carly Valles

customer_reviews.title: Go bigger on the filter
customer_reviews.text: I got a few adapteRs to hook this up to my 900 gal extra large kiddie pool. Love it. Once the water chemistry is balanced, it makes maintenance simple and the water crystal clear. I change the filter every other weeks, with daily use with 2 kids.
customer_reviews.author: LLL

customer_reviews.title: Its broken... after just a few days
customer_reviews.text: I'm having an issue with this filter. We just replaced this exact model. This one sounds like grinding noises. Needs to be flushed every 20 mins to keep working and new filters do not fix the issue. I'm about to return this.. but right now I know pool supplies are hard to find... not sure what to do...
customer_reviews.author: JTL

customer_reviews.title: Pump works good. Nothing wrong with the pump other than this ...
customer_reviews.text: Pump works good. Nothing wrong with the pump other than this was a replacement for a 3 yr old pump. I would NOT recommend INTEX pools to anyone. The pool itself only lasted through one winter storage. Could not find a replacement liner so a bought a regular above ground liner and 'duck taped' it over the Ultra Frame intex pool. IT WORKED. On our second year with no leaks. Looks like crap but it's still clean and swimable. Hope to buy a 'real' above ground pool next year.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works but doesn't do much to keep the pool ...
customer_reviews.text: It works but doesn't do much to keep the pool clean. Even with a smaller pool you really need a bigger pump. Mine didn't come with clamps to hold it on and the water inlet part was to big to fit in the premade hole of my pool. Still though I've been using it for a few months now and it's still working so I guess that's something.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya

customer_reviews.title: Pump lasted three months!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this filter pump on June 5th of this year. it lasted almost three months before the impeller just froze up. The pump never ran dry and it was kept covered from the beginning. I also tried to send an email to their support but after filling the information out it would not let me submit the form. Needless to say I am very disappointed in this product and will not purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Uneasywriter

customer_reviews.title: Intex 1500gph pool filter pump
customer_reviews.text: Intex 1500gph pool filter pump works GREAT for my 8ft. stock tank pool. The water IS krystal clear! VM is a wonderful seller no problems with my order and it was shipped in a timely manner, they were great HIGHLY recommend VM Express.
customer_reviews.author: todd johnson

customer_reviews.title: work fine for what they're designed
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a backup and supplement to my sand filter. Its good for what its designed - small pools. Its also works well as an isolated pump/filter to my solar panel for the pool. Seem to get 3 or 4 seasons out of them before they crap out.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: but with some fantastic videos on youtube I was able to get this ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would have to return this at first, but with some fantastic videos on youtube I was able to get this hooked up and working with my 10' x 30" pool. This works perfectly with the GAME 4550 filter hose conversion kit.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Be warned this is pump and hoses only!
customer_reviews.text: This pump only comes with hoses. None of the fittings needed are included. When calling intel they informed us that we had to purchase the fittings and other parts separately to the tune of $60 plus shipping. Shipping takes 10-14 business days. So here we sit waiting and we don’t even know if the pump works at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lambert

customer_reviews.title: The Intex 1500-Gallon filter
customer_reviews.text: This 1500-Gallon Intex filter replaced a Intex 1000-Gallon filter that came with a 15' above ground pool. The 1000 gal. filter was doing OK but you can't have pool water clean enough. Had to buy adapters for the hoses but hooking the bigger filter with a timer was no problem. It's been working for about a month now with no problems. The bigger filter is a bit louder. Also with a bigger filter, vacuuming with a better suction helps clean the pool better.
customer_reviews.author: P H Factor

customer_reviews.title: Motor impeller shaft last 1 year only
customer_reviews.text: Ceramic impeller shaft broke after a year. It’s imposible to find a replacement. Some people sell a metallic alternative but they las less than a month. Basically if you choose to buy this model, you will need to by it every year.
customer_reviews.author: Amel

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade from Original
customer_reviews.text: This was a great upgrade to the pump that originally came with the above ground pool. This pump really has the power to clear and circulate the pool verses the original. I was hesitant at first to spend the extra money but when the original pump broke I decided to upgrade and what a different this pump made.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Escamilla

customer_reviews.title: Does the job great!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy set up almost ready to go. Simple instructions for timed or continuous use. Mine actually runs a fountain with only slight rework. Easy filter change, almost no priming. Quiet, Dependable, again mine runs 24/7.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Damico

customer_reviews.title: Electrical burns out fast.
customer_reviews.text: I have made the mistake of purchasing this product each time it fails to work. In every case the unit stops turning on especially after a filter change. My 3rd filter was purchased in October 2017. Very little use in winter! Preparing for the summer and this filter has once again crapped out... Two choices. Be dumb again and buy another or get smart and purchase an entirely new pool made any where and by anyone other than Intex.
customer_reviews.author: Norm E

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement pump for the Intex pool - more power
customer_reviews.text: Love the timer. Buy the adapters 1.25' to 1.5" thru Amazon because these hoses are larger than the ones that come with the pump that comes with pool. However, once you have the adapters it is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: M. P.

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Product is defective doesn't pump water. Seller will not refund money
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Timer is a good feature. Would have liked to know that I needed adapters to fit with what is already on my pool. Does not have the suction or power I thought it was supposed to. Not living up to expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a long lasting product
customer_reviews.text: The pump worked well until nearly exactly one year from date of arrival when the motor stopped working. Naturally, warranty is one year. I would have expected it to last longer than just one year.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Hoefling

customer_reviews.title: Died within the 3 month warranty period, very difficult to get the replacement pump
customer_reviews.text: The pump worked great for two months, then died, before the 3 month warranty was up. I placed numerous emails and calls and even a letter with purchase information so that I could receive my replacement pump and I am still waiting. I’ve called th 1-800 number numerous times during business hours but the message says to call back during business hours. I hate to leave a poor review..but it’s the truth. Hoping I’ll receive the replacement pump soon.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Davignon Semon

customer_reviews.title: Get you one of these!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the supplied 1000 gph pump supplied does not have a timer and the instructions make it clear to not plug into a timer because of the GFCI. Set up is easy and my pool already came with adapters for the larger diameter hoses. You can run it continuously or use the timer with 2, 4, 6, 8, 12 hour settings and it repeats every 24 hours. The extra oomph makes the skimmer basket work better and the salt water system.
customer_reviews.author: Mobi-wan Canobere

customer_reviews.title: This was defeated from the time i got it but due to covid now im out money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump called customer service right away cause i would hear strange noises coming from the pump. At the time the pump wasnt avavible but now it mess up amd out of money
customer_reviews.author: camil

customer_reviews.title: Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Trying to figure out something different for our in takes, seems as though too much is getting in. But the pump works as expected with timer function! Love it and it’s quiet too
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure it's good enough.
customer_reviews.text: Expected much more suction power than this has. Almost feels like the water in side is gravity fed and pushed out into the pool with only slightly better pressure than the original pump that came with the pool.
customer_reviews.author: S. Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied
customer_reviews.text: It did not have all those hoses that were supposed to be included.
customer_reviews.author: Tarrah

customer_reviews.title: 25 hose connection this pump is great but buy the (INTEX 1
customer_reviews.text: If you have an older intex pool that uses 1.25 hose connection this pump is great but buy the (INTEX 1.25" to 1.5" Type B Hose Adapters for Pumps & Saltwater System | Set of 2 from my quick buy) as they have the best price on the adapter needed for the conversion . This pump works great I love the fact that it has a timer on it, and the hose connection is straight forward and easy to connect to.
customer_reviews.author: Stormsage

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the first day then you need to change the filter, because there is no force coming out of the filter, I should have know better after seeing so many for sale!
customer_reviews.author: Eric E.

customer_reviews.title: Good for a season or two.
customer_reviews.text: This is our third pump, after a season the impeller for the pump starts to crack and fails. I've taken these apart to see whats going on, so the windings are incased in plastic housing then the impeller a cylindrical magnet is formed in plastic with the impeller fins at the front. Well the plastic around the magnet begins to crack and comes apart in pieces. They are a cheap pump so expect what you pay for. Like the timer.
customer_reviews.author: Grafx

customer_reviews.title: Sounds sad, works like mad
customer_reviews.text: Worked great all season. No leaks and provided great water flow through three flat on the ground heating mats. The only downside is the sounds that it makes. It constantly sounded like it was on it’s last legs. I think that’s just the louder sounds it makes though. I expect it to give us another season of great filtration.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S

customer_reviews.title: If you purchase this product, get the extended warranty
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item on May 23rd, had it installed by June 1st, 2019. Always ran pump on 6 hour cycle daily. Cleaned filter every week. (Bigger pump than original) I disconnected the pump in October 1 and reconnected May 1st. (7 months stored, not used) It has a 1 year warranty. My unit is 1 year and 3 months old and the pump has locked up. 09/08/2020. It will pay to buy the extended warranty
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Help needed with hook up
customer_reviews.text: I need help. Our pump came, it only has the dial. Not the on/off switch and the dial. Hooked it up before we realized, somethings wrong. No suction. Can any one help?
customer_reviews.author: Bcecil

customer_reviews.title: This seller make the return process difficult
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product for my grand daughter's new 12x30 round metal pool and didn't get the standard pump bc the reviews discussed how well this one worked. Unfortunately, it isn't compatible with my pool so I ordered the correct one and submit a return request for this product. It's taking days for them to respond. Im not sure what's going on n with this seller but this is a little ridiculous considering it never took this long with previous returns.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Stock Tank Pool!
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a pump that would move the water around but not create a whirlpool, this is perfect! It was super easy to install and is working perfectly. The Timer is a little confusing but once we figured out the function it has been perfect for our pool.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Pump didn't last 9 months (4 working)
customer_reviews.text: The pump was a great upgrade from the small one that came with the pool. I did have to purchase adapters, since these hoses are bigger. Problem is that I purchased in July 2019, set up my pool a couple of weeks ago (late march 2020), worked for a couple of weeks and now... nothing! You can feel it vibrates, so it is on, but pump not working. Has not lasted but a total of 4 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Dale A. Cavage

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Used it for a small 10Ft round pool. Worked great. Easy to clean and install filters. To prime it put hose into intake valve until water comes out exit valve then make sure you open top valve to let air out of filter chamber.
customer_reviews.author: Realalien

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Works well. It is a much cheaper option to a chlorine pool. Saltwater is so much easier to maintain and this conversion pump does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Monica C. Whinery

customer_reviews.title: Open immediately to verify all parts are present...
customer_reviews.text: Not that the pump is bad (I have no idea), but the package is missing quite a few pieces. I am missing the all items from the parts reference #8-13, which is everything connecting the hoses to the pool. Too bad there is such a short window to do anything about it as well. I purchased the pump just over a month ago, and amazon states I am past the point of returning it. I just opened it to install it. I wish I had known there was such a short window to return the item. Now I have to buy all parts individually....
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Foss

customer_reviews.title: Noisy!!
customer_reviews.text: I did purchase this as a replacement for my above-ground pool. It works well and has a lot of power, but I find it incredibly noisy and can't bear to run it. It's so loud that it has me thinking that I should just sell the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Atherton

customer_reviews.title: Great pump equals beautiful pool
customer_reviews.text: We live in the country and deal with road dust which turns our pool green even with chemical. The pump we had last year didnt move the water enough so we upgraded to this. We had to purchase adapters to use with the old pump's hoses but had no trouble with that. Our pool has been up a week, we have put chemical in it only once and it is crystal clear. We run it a minimum of 4 hours a day. This was a fantastic purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy L

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our blow up pools.
customer_reviews.text: We are using it for 2 blow up pools (103x60). It keep the water moving, removes small debris, and allows cleaning chemicals to circulate. We did not "install" it. We have a skimmer portable basket so it can be moved from pool to pool.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Maple

customer_reviews.title: NOT happy.
customer_reviews.text: It was missing the entire outlet strainer grid assembly. Went on intex website to order one. Big surprise, they were out of stock. Something sounds broken inside of it. NOT happy We previously had the 1000 pump. UPDATE: switched the hoses to larger ones, clamped them on with automotive clamps at the pool side. Still loud as heck.
customer_reviews.author: scarlett

customer_reviews.title: L O U D
customer_reviews.text: LOUD !! I initially thought it was broken but after reading reviews it seems to work just fine ... just LOUD ... you can hear it thru a patio door and over the TV when it's on
customer_reviews.author: MoMo Inc.

product_meta.title: Intex 28635EG Krystal Clear Cartridge Filter Pump for Above Ground Pools, 1500 GPH Pump Flow Rate, 110-120V with GFCI
product_meta.description: Keep your pool water Krystal Clear and refreshing this summer with the Intex 1,500 GPH Filter Cartridge Pump! Boasting a pump flow rate of 1,500 gallons per hour and a system flow rate of 1,180 gallons per hour, this pump will circulate and filter the water in your above ground pool to keep everything clean, refreshing, and fun. In addition, the maintenance for this pump is a breeze: just the occasional cartridge rinse or swap to keep this pump running strong. This filter uses Type A filter cartridges (Item #29000E) which should be changed every couple of weeks. This pump is a must have for any above ground pool up to 18 feet in diameter, see for yourself! Lastly, this pump features a built-in timer to set the operating time, making it incredibly simple and convenient to use. NOTE: If the pump will not start at all, check the GFCI outlet on the plug to ensure it has been properly reset for use and check that the GFCI is not being plugged into an extension cord. Refer to page 13 in manual (Other content) for troubleshooting steps.
feature_bullets: Specially designed for above ground pools. For use with Intex Easy Set pool models 18’, Frame pool models 16’ or 18’, Oval Frame pool models 20’ X 12’.
Easy installation – just attach hoses via 1.5" hose fittings and plug in (Partial assembly required).
System flow rate: 1,180 gph (2,839 lph). Pump flow rate: 1,500 gph (3,785 lph)
Double insulated pump. Auto timer with preset 2 to 12 hour cycles.
Includes one easy to clean, replaceable filter cartridge. For best results, replace filter cartridge every 2 weeks. Replacement cartridge: Type A/C.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,620 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
